result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:36 a.m. Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CF194, 15CF257, and 15CF359 are heard today.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 Plea to 15CF194 Count 2 and 15CF257.  15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3. W/H Sentence 2yr probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF194 Count 2 - No Contest
15CF257 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF194 Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
 15CF359 and 15CF194 Counts 1 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
15CF194 has 1 day credit and 15CF257 has 2 days credit.
Atty Cveykus concurs with joint recommendation. Already done AODA and is in counseling. 

Defendant makes statements.
BY THE COURT:****PROBATION*****
 15CF194
 W /H  Sentence (1 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation (may be served in Marathon County)
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.  
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.  
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CF257 W /H  Sentence (2 day credit, if revoked)
  2 yrs  Probation, concurrent with 15CF194.
Comply with same conditions as stated in 15CF194.
Pay costs, Drug, DNA surcharge.

15CV182 cash $230 forfeited and $655 returned to Defendant.  Clerk to prepare an order stating so.

Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Bond continued.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas Aidan Bembenek Jr.
Current: 1121 N 4th Ave, Apt 2, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 2156 Cty Rd Y, Stevens Point, WI 54482
Comply with all conditions of pending cases.

Defendant Thomas Aidan Bembenek in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant says he has an attorney.
ADA Constable requests a cash bond.  
Court set sig bond.

  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
